summary: Efforts to reduce hospital readmissions have combined policy incentives and transitional care strategies. While broad interventions like HRRP have improved outcomes modestly, more intensive approaches like Camden Coalition’s care management model have yielded mixed or null results, revealing a selective gap between evidence and implementation. New innovations in AI have showed promising results.

articles.title: Evaluation of the Camden Coalition’s Care Management Intervention
articles.summary: A randomized controlled trial found that the Camden Coalition’s intensive care management program did not reduce 180-day readmission rates among high-utilizer patients, contradicting earlier hopes based on observational results.

implementation_examples.title: Camden Care Coalition replication programs redesigned after RCT null result

articles.title: Medicare’s Hospital Readmissions Reduction Program (HRRP) Evaluation
articles.summary: Multiple studies show that Medicare's HRRP led to moderate declines in 30-day readmissions, particularly for conditions like heart failure and pneumonia, by encouraging improvements in transitional care practices.

implementation_examples.title: HRRP implemented across all U.S. hospitals with measurable decline in readmission rates

articles.title: Medically Tailored Meals for People with HIV: A Randomized Controlled Trial
articles.summary: A randomized trial found that nutritionally vulnerable people with HIV who received medically tailored meals had an 89% reduction in hospitalizations over 6 months compared to controls.

implementation_examples.title: Fresh Food Farmacy by Geisinger Health
California CalAIM Medicaid Waiver for MTMs
Boston Medical Center’s Food for Health Program

articles.title: Impact of Medically Tailored Meals on Healthcare Utilization and Costs
articles.summary: Observational studies found that MTM recipients at Massachusetts General Hospital had 49% fewer hospital admissions and 16% lower healthcare costs over a 10-week period compared to non-recipients.

implementation_examples.title: Medicaid MTM Pilots in CA, NY, OR, WA

articles.title: Projected National Savings from Medically Tailored Meals
articles.summary: Simulation research estimates that scaling MTMs nationally for high-risk patients could prevent 1.6 million hospitalizations annually and save $13.6 to $32 billion in healthcare costs.

articles.title: Implementation of Artificial Intelligence-Based Clinical Decision Support to Reduce Hospital Readmissions at a Regional Hospital
articles.authors: Santiago Romero-Brufau, Kirk D Wyatt, Patricia Boyum, Mindy Mickelson, Matthew Moore, Cheristi Cognetta-Rieke
articles.summary: This study implemented an AI-based decision support tool in a regional hospital to reduce readmissions. The tool identified high-risk patients and recommended interventions. Compared to controls, the hospital saw a 25% relative reduction in readmissions during the 6-month intervention period.
